BottLess 回應長洲餐盒存放]
(English available below)

社會創效企業 BottLess 於 2018 年 8 月份一連四個週末舉辦「無塑好日子．長洲」，提供首個於離島舉辦的餐盒借用服務，更聯合了20間長洲小店支持。活動中所有使用過的餐盒交由區內餐具消毒公司承辦清潔服務。

「無塑好日子．長洲」活動預留 4,000 套餐盒借出使用，活動後餐盒已作清洗消毒及重用，以支援其他大型活動，例如「Shape Fashion 衣．觀」市集、中大逸夫書院逸夫里2018、SOGO x 合廠HATCH聖誕派對 。另外BottLess 留下400套餐盒予3間長洲小店，包括老泥丸、和屋及Corner Garden Crepes & Drinks，直至現在仍然繼續讓顧客租借使用。

8月活動後BottLess 已收回大部分餐盒，惟有250個未曾使用的餐盒遺漏於區內餐具消毒公司，BottLess事前並不知悉。網上的圖片流傳後，BottLess現已即時聯絡該餐具消毒公司，協商馬上收回餘下的250個餐盒，送到由通過香港安全檢定及ISO22000-2005的自營清潔工場BottLess Zero 以機器重新清洗及消毒，以供未來活動繼續使用。

該事件引致社會的關注及誤會，BottLess在此謹向相關受影響人士致歉。BottLess 未來會繼續改善香港的即棄塑膠廢物問題，策劃鼓勵公眾參與的活動，達至省資源、省時間、省成本、減地球負擔。

In August 2018, social purpose organization BottLess launched “Have a PlasticFree Day@Cheung Chau”, the first-ever utensils lending service in Cheung Chau. Held on 4 consecutive weekends during the month, the event lined up 20 local eateries to support the initiative. All reusable food containers used in the event were handed over to a local dishware-washing company for cleaning.

“Have a PlasticFree Day@Cheung Chau” has ordered 4,000 sets of reusable food containers for rental. After the event, the food containers have been cleaned, sanitized and re-used to support other large events, including “My Fair Lady Shape Fashion 2018”, “CUHK Shawlane Fair 2018” and “SOGO x HATCH Christmas Party 2018” (please refer to images of event below). BottLess has also offered 400 reusable food containers to 3 local eateries in Cheung Chau to continue the rental service, including Old Old Maru, Wo Uk and Corner Garden Crepes & Drinks. The eateries have been operating the service for visiting customers since the event (please refer to images of events below).

After the event ended in August, BottLess has collected most of the reusable food containers, except 250 unused containers which remained at the local dishware-washing company. BottLess was not aware and informed of these remaining containers. After photos were released online, BottLess has contacted the dishware-washing company instantly and is arranging the immediate collection of the remaining 250 food containers with the company. The food containers will be sent to BottLess Zero, the first factory in Hong Kong that specializes in event and catering dishware-washing solutions verified with ISO22000-2005. The cups will be machine-washed, sterilized and dried for reuse in future events.

BottLess apologizes to all affected parties and public concern caused by this incident. BottLess will continue to commit its efforts in reducing single-use plastic consumption in Hong Kong through curating “zero-waste” events that are hassle-saving, time-saving, cost-saving and planet-friendly to motivate public participation in sustainability.
